remarks: Concatenation of words follow the rule ~ mulgnn0dir (although applying ~ mulgnn0dir would require ` S ` to be a set).  In this case ` A ` is ` <" K "> ` to the power ` M ` in the free monoid.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 5-Oct-2018.)
statement:
ccatmulgnn0dir.a $e |- A = ( ( 0 ..^ M ) X. { K } ) $.
ccatmulgnn0dir.b $e |- B = ( ( 0 ..^ N ) X. { K } ) $.
ccatmulgnn0dir.c $e |- C = ( ( 0 ..^ ( M + N ) ) X. { K } ) $.
ccatmulgnn0dir.k $e |- ( ph -> K e. S ) $.
ccatmulgnn0dir.m $e |- ( ph -> M e. NN0 ) $.
ccatmulgnn0dir.n $e |- ( ph -> N e. NN0 ) $.
ccatmulgnn0dir $p |- ( ph -> ( A concat B ) = C ) $.
